page.title: 05THE GLEN AT ALVA
page.content: The Alva{Glen}is between Torry and Nebit. About 100 years ago the lower part of the Glen was specially laid out with paths,bridges,trees,and flowering shrubs for the local people to enjoy their{recreation.}There is a memorial to Mr John Eadie who was born in Alva. There are two waterfalls. The Glen also leads to the Ochil{Hills}and to the source of the Devon. People can also fish in the Dam. The Glen has paths including a zig zag path up to the back of the Glen and a square piece of land where the band used to play. A burn separates the Glen into two. It is part of the beautiful Alva{landscape.}
